posts.post_content: ...but I wouldn't pay 6 for a 4/3 flier. Some undying seems very cheap, and other undying seems too expensive. I'm sure they tested the pants off the mechanic, though, so I'll just wait and see how things play out.

Posted By: grynning (2/5/2012 7:50:24 AM)

posts.post_content:
"Hey. I've just created this amazing card"  
  
"is it using the Undying mechanic?"  
  
"You bet you a$$ it does! And not only that, but it is a 3/2 flyer!"  
  
"Amazing! What a perfect card! What's its CMC?"  
  
"it's... Uhh..."  
  
"4?"  
  
"Uhh..."  
  
"...5?"  
  
"... 6"  
  
"6... huh. Well, at... huh, that's quite high. I guess if we made it 4, it wouldn't be that fair..."  
  
"Yeah. If we made [a creature with an equal CMC-to-P/T with undying](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Young_Wolf), that would be quite broken!"  
  
"Thank god there isn't [something like that](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Strangleroot_Geist)!"
posts.html:
"Hey. I've just created this amazing card"

"is it using the Undying mechanic?"

"You bet you a$$ it does! And not only that, but it is a 3/2 flyer!"

"Amazing! What a perfect card! What's its CMC?"

"it's... Uhh..."

"4?"

"Uhh..."

"...5?"

"... 6"

"6... huh. Well, at... huh, that's quite high. I guess if we made it 4, it wouldn't be that fair..."

"Yeah. If we made a creature with an equal CMC-to-P/T with undying, that would be quite broken!"

"Thank god there isn't something like that!"

posts.post_content:
He wields the full power of flight unfettered by the social norms of a shirt.  
Seriously though, how is he flying? I'm not saying Vampires should grow wings and pretend to be Black Angels or something-- but he doesn't even have a CAPE! ALL FLYING VAMPIRES SHOULD HAVE CAPES!!!!  
It's the Alan Rickman Rule. (I know Severus wasn’t really a vampire. Shut up, capes are awesome.)   
Dear Wizards, you make Magic, not Twilight. Please remember this.

Posted By: DarthParallax (3/9/2012 9:54:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
the main problem is that he's compared to things like [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk) rather than looked at on his own. Mechanically he costs the same as 2 [Markov Patrician](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Markov Patrician) and is a little stronger and has evasion in exchange for lifelink. He's essentially two creatures in one which is very unusual in black.   
  
he could work very well in any vampire deck, and even better in any vampire deck that focuses on doubling counters the vampires place on themselves (since he would already have one on himself already). it is too bad that he's not 5cc, but they probably didn't want him competing with the Sengir staple.  
  
\*edit\* and really? this is the one that has a "no wings omg so unrealistic and it's a dude so that means it's TWILIGHT" comment on it? vamps fly with psychic powers dude. like levitate. they don't need wings, and also I think it's refreshing to see one vampire in the set that's not a blood-crazed goth-\*\*\*.
posts.html:
the main problem is that he's compared to things like Vampire Nighthawk rather than looked at on his own. Mechanically he costs the same as 2 Markov Patrician and is a little stronger and has evasion in exchange for lifelink. He's essentially two creatures in one which is very unusual in black.

he could work very well in any vampire deck, and even better in any vampire deck that focuses on doubling counters the vampires place on themselves (since he would already have one on himself already). it is too bad that he's not 5cc, but they probably didn't want him competing with the Sengir staple.

*edit* and really? this is the one that has a "no wings omg so unrealistic and it's a dude so that means it's TWILIGHT" comment on it? vamps fly with psychic powers dude. like levitate. they don't need wings, and also I think it's refreshing to see one vampire in the set that's not a blood-crazed goth-***.

Posted By: Ferlord (4/8/2012 9:36:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Paying six mana for a vampire is asinine. If I'm going to do so, I expect a similar effect on the game to something like [Nirkana Revenant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nirkana Revenant) or [Vein Drinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vein Drinker). Frankly, the very top of a vampire deck mana curve should be four, if you're going to accommodate [Bloodline Keeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodline Keeper), though it should probably be more like three.  
  
Oh well. They can't all be good cards.
posts.html:
Paying six mana for a vampire is asinine. If I'm going to do so, I expect a similar effect on the game to something like Nirkana Revenant or Vein Drinker. Frankly, the very top of a vampire deck mana curve should be four, if you're going to accommodate Bloodline Keeper, though it should probably be more like three.

Oh well. They can't all be good cards.
